Introduction to Software Testing
 Testing is an activity in which tester test the functionality of an application in order to find a defect according to the client's requirement.


 Functionality means that
 - Whether individual components (Buttons, Dropdown Menu, Radio Button, Checkboxes etc.) are working properly or not?
 - Whether user able to go to the other screens or not?
 - Whether the purpose of the screen is fulfilled or not. For e.g. Search screen, so, user should able to search any of the item.
 - Whether the application created by the developer fulfilled the purpose or not?
 - Whether application crashes or not?


 Non-Functionality (Moral Duty of tester, not mentioned in the requirement)
 - Whether the application running smooth or not? For e.g. user faces some problem regarding of too much delay on going from one screen to another.
 - Whether app responding to every unhandled situation or not? For e.g. in case, user switch off the internet, then, whether they getting the appropriate message or not?
 - Whether the app design in such a manner that user able to use application or not? No complicated flows should be there.
 - Whether the app is secured or not?
